metadata.title: Anti-Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus Immune Responses: The Role Played by Vg9Vd2 T Cells

abstract.original_text: Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) is caused by a novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV) strain and is clinically similar to many other acute respiratory infections [1, 2]. Its symptoms include high fever, chills, rigors, dyspnea, nonproductive cough, myalgias,

sentences.segment_text: Severe acute respiratory syndrome ( SARS ) is caused by a novel coronavirus ( SARS-CoV ) strain and is clinically similar to many other acute respiratory infections ( 1 , 2 ) .
chills , rigors , dyspnea , nonproductive cough , myalgias ,
